intro: Uncinia subsacculata, commonly known as the sac-like hookweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its unique morphology includes hooked bracts that give it its common name. Uncinia subsacculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
